The variety of cough medicine confuses Laz as he examines them. ANGELA approaches Laz. She is dressed in a floral print d with a white lab coat. Angela has a few extra pounds on h but she wears it well with her caring face and sweet mann
Lazarus?
(startled) Oh! Gave me a start.
I'm sorry. It's these soft shoes I  wear for my back.
You hurt it?
I'm standing most of my day. They're  for support. (a smile) Didn't see you in church this mornin'.
(tries to lie) Been on the crop. May need to get  some extra hands if I don't want to  work on Sundays.
Well. It's good to see you.
Angela wants the conversation to continue but Laz remains silent. She smiles awkwardly.
Angela?
Yes?
I need to uh...
Go on, Laz. You can talk to me.
My little niece... she got this deep  cough.
You take her to a doctor?

(struggles to lie) No. No, she can't go. Mean to say...  they's just no money fo'a doctor.  Her daddy left for a job, and uh...  give her to me to look on. I just... (a pitiful pause) I don't know what to do.
Angela thinks for a moment.
You wait right here.

Snot and spittle has run down the side of Rae's face -- h eyelids stick together as she tries to open them. There is a creak, followed by another. Rae has become awa that someone is slowly walking up the front porch. The door opens. Silhouetted in the day's blinding light i white man in his 40's. His face is indistinguishable to R affected gaze. Is this a dream? He stands above her and lights a cigarette. The Zippo lig clasps shut. The man lowers it to his side where Rae can it clearly. A bald eagle is printed on the side, a sight  that makes Rae's eyes open wide in horror. Her breath grows deeper -- a girlish plea. This is no dre it's a nightmare.
Mm-mm... Mm-mm...

A massive hand slaps down over her mouth. Her crusted eye peer above the hairy knuckles. He sucks on the cigarette. red cherry blazes at the end. The man pushes the blanket of her and grips her panties. Rae's eyes close. She knows what is next. In his clenched fist, the panties are ripped off.
NOOOOO!

Rae flinches awake from the fever-induced nightmare and f to the wooden floor, drenched in sweat. Weakened and shak she scampers away, finally collapsing in the kitchen. Her hand reaches out and lands on the strings of Laz's guitar the floor. She grips the steel strings with her trembling fingers. A single bass note twangs as she passes out.
Angela stands between the aisles, motioning Laz to approa away from the girl at the counter.
Is your niece older than 12?
Oh, she older than that.
She hands him a white box with cough syrup inside.

My sister got a bad cough with her  pneumonia. I just copied her  prescription. You don't need to pay  anything... just take it. But if she  gets worse, you give me a call. I  wrote my number on the box.
This gonna get you in trouble?
Not if no one finds out.
Laz doesn't know what to say. He puts the box in his pock
Thank you. (suddenly awkward) Oh. My wife. She had a card here for  her migraine pills. She ain't gonna  be around no more... So if you...
I already tossed that out. (takes a step closer) Somethin' you should'a done to that  woman long ago... how she treated  you. Of course, that's none of my  business.
(smiles) Don't make it less true.
Angela returns the smile.
Laz opens his truck door and stops. At the pool-hall acro the square, Laz sees a green Cutlass with chrome rims.
Laz enters the empty pool hall. Tehronne is playing a gam with a skinny playa-wanna-be dressed in flea-market Fubu. CHARLIE, the owner, approaches Laz from the bar.
Hey, Lazarus. We closed up on Sunday.
Need a word with Tehronne.
(calling to the back) Yo, T! Laz wanna holla at cha.
Come on back, Cuz.
Charlie nods Laz on. He crosses to the back pool table as Tehronne sinks the 8. Tehronne looks at his friend.
Do you call it a game when only one  man win each time? I think you call  it a damn shame.
Word wit'cha. In private.
Tehronne hands his friend the pool cue. The two take a fe steps away to talk.
You need some weed?
Been years since I fooled with that. (tries to find the  words) You know a white girl? Dirty blond  hair, split down the middle like?
(smiles) That ain't up to me to hook you up.  Naw what I mean? She her own, you  know?
Huh?

I don't pimp that. (silence) You talkin' about who I think you  talkin' about, you mean Rae. Rae  Doole. Sexy little split tail, like  you say. I can't hook you up with  that. I got two girls. One ain't in  town, the other one pregnant. So...  you on your own.
This Rae... you get with her?
Shit. Who hasn't?
Why you say that?
She got a spare minute she'll snatch  up anyone... but me, I'm different.  Sometimes she need the real deal, so  she call me up. Girl got an itch.  You know... what's a nigga to do?
She like it rough? You like beatin'  on her?
That ain't my scene. If that's  somethin' you into...
Now, hold up.
See, that girl is in my favor. You  heard me, nigga? You fuck with her  rough, and you got me to fuck wit.
You collar that dog, boy. I ain't  gonna hurt nobody. Just wanted to  know who she was.
Like I say, you wanna hook that up...  I ain't in ya way. That switch of  hers been all over this town. Got  that sickness, you know.
What'chu sayin'?
She a freak. Got what you call a  sexual addiction.
Lazarus looks at him with a furrowed brow. Confused.
What'chu sayin'?
What I'm tellin' you. Girl gotta get  dick or she go crazy.
Laz opens his own door with caution. He turns to see Rae  sprawled in his kitchen in her panties and T-shirt. He ru to her side.
Gal? Miss Rae? Rae, you hear me?
Lazarus lifts her sweaty body off the floor and moves her back to the couch. Consciousness briefly returns to Rae in her feverish haze
The white-knuckled hand clutched around her mouth.
Rae flinches and flails. She falls to the floor.
Hold on, now. Hold on!
Rae's eyes are open and filled with fear. She struggles t flee as Laz holds her in place, trying to reassure her.

Now, I ain't gonna hurt'cha. Calm  down, Miss. (she fights, coughs) Listen... Listen... LISTEN NOW, GAL! (Rae settles in his  grip) I ain't gonna hurt ya, hear? Gotta  get you well. Now, look me... HEY!  Look me in the eye.
Rae is too weak to talk or move. Laz clutches her small f in his dark hands.
Open your eyes. Go'on, now. You need  to see, ain't no harm here. Ain't no  harm. (Rae calms) My name is Lazarus Woods. And I ain't  gonna let you die.

Rae's eyes roll back. Lazarus looks terrified as she cranes her head back and  forward. Her mouth opens. In her sickened state, with the force of something evil a deep inside, Rae clasps her open mouth over Laz's. A shri sounds in his brain as he holds her tighter, allowing the kiss to grow in intensity. Rae falls to her stomach as La abruptly stands and stumbles across the room. What he see chills him to the bone. Rae is writhing on the floor as if she is possessed -- a  rant of raspy words pour from her mouth.
...you don't... touch me... s'no...  NO! Mm-mm... Mm-MMMMMMMMMMMMM! N- N'you FUCK!

Lazarus gets spooked by what he is seeing. He looks to th mantle. His weathered Bible lies in a coat of dust. He pi it up as a wave of the burning hits Rae. She clutches her breast and crotch, rolling from side to  side.
Mm-mm... mm-mm... Ma-muh... Ma-MUH! (sudden anger, shouting) See... S... See if'I GIVE... GIVE'A...  SHIT...
Rose is shouting at the customers in the cafe. Her eyes a white like Rae's. Her voice is not her own but that of Ra
(screaming) 'BOUT ANY OF YOU PEOPLE!

Laz runs out of his own home, not even shutting the door  behind him. He gets half way down his drive, the Bible st clutched in his hand. He stops. In a panic, Laz opens his Bible, places it down on the dr face up, creating a barrier to evil. He hears a choking c inside the house. Rae is fighting for breath beyond the d door. Silence. Laz reaches down and picks up his Bible. A passage catches his eye. As he reads, the fear vanishes from his face. His back straightens. His jaw tightens. He looks back at his house, his faith is renewed.
The Bible is slammed down on top of the toilet tank. The  bathtub faucet coughs as Laz twists the cold water knob.
The freezer door opens. He snatches four trays of ice.
The trays crack. The ice cubes bounce into the tub.
Rae's lips are dried and split as she pants, lost in dizz fever. Laz lifts her.
Laz kneels on one knee to put her into the tub. A horrible cry from Rae as Laz wrestles with her, keeping her submerged in the ice cold water.
I know, child, I know. Gotta break  that fever now. (Rae sobs, struggles) Don't mean to hurt'chu. But I ain't  lettin' you die. (holding her down) I AIN'T LETTIN' YOU DIE!

Rae is motionless. Exhausted. Her eyes are open but blind Her lip trembles. Her body shakes from the freezing water Laz rubs the hair from her face gently. He reaches over t the Bible on the toilet and opens it to read.

Put fear of the Devil in me, gal.  Got me spooked like I's a kid, I  tell you. (flips through the  pages) But the good Lord, He showed me what  to do. He come knockin' like my man  R.L. say... listen here... (Rae sobs like a child) This here Matthew. He talkin' on how  Jesus was healin' the sick. And a  man come up to the disciples and he  say... (reads deliberately) Have mercy on my son, for he is a  lunatic, and sore vexed... (to Rae) He got the devil in his mind and  sores on his skin. (reads) And he brought the boy to the  disciples, but they could NOT cure  him.
Rae's shivering is abating. Her eyes fight to stay open. touches her forehead to test her temperature.

(reading) Then Jesus answered and said, O  faithless and perverse generation...  how long shall I suffer you? Bring  the boy hither to me. And Jesus  rebuked the devil. (to Rae) You hear that? (reads) Then the disciples say... Why could  not we cast the devil out? And Jesus  said unto them...
Rae's eyes begin to close. Laz gently touches her head to rile her awake.

Listen now... This what he sayin' to  us. He say... (reads) If ye have faith... if ye have faith  as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall  say unto a mountain, remove hence...  and it... shall... move. And  nothin'... nothin' shall be impossible  to you. (to Rae) You hear that? You just need a bit  of faith. You just gotta believe you  gonna get well, like I do.
He touches her forehead again. Her eyes close.
That's better. You coolin' down.  Okay. You rest. Okay. You rest.
Laz leans against the wall, spent.
The cicadas sing in a rising chorus as the clouds above f from copper to crimson.

The faint echo of Rae's fevered panting. She lies on the couch wrapped in a quilt, shivering. Her  eyes remain closed, her face drenched with sweat. Laz has cleaned her facial wounds, using a few Band-Aids.

An explosion ignites the windows surrounding the cabin. R jolts awake, terror pervades her as she gasps at the fire ball outside the window. She struggles to her feet and listens. A faint sound can heard through the roar of the flames. beep beep... beep  beep... beep beep... beep beep...
(a whisper) Ronnie...
Rae stumbles to the door, weak and dizzy. She grips the d knob and pulls the door open.
Rae races outside, tripping down the front porch steps. S looks off at the blaze in the squash field. She frantical races toward the fire, the beeping increases.
Ronnie... RONNIE!

head_text.subj: BEEP BEEP... BEEP BEEP... BEEP BEEP... BEEP BEEP...

text: At the center of the blaze is an upside down Humvee. To t left of the vehicle, a few soldier's bodies lay scattered Rae's legs lose all strength, she collapses and crawls ac the squash plants. A far away voice is heard over the roaring flames.
Gal? Gal?

Rae crawls across a fallen soldier, following the sound o Ronnie's alarm. She struggles to breathe, she almost fain She finds a soldier face down. With all her strength she  turns him over. It is Ronnie, wide-eyed and lifeless. An awful groan comes out of Rae -- crippling sorrow. She  pulls on his vest trying to wake him.
(sobbing) Nn-nn... Nn-nn... no... N'RONNIE!
GAL! YOU HEARIN' MY VOICE?
Rae looks up. The flaming humvee is gone. She is not pull on Ronnie's vest, but the tangled vines of a squash plant Laz stands at a safe distance, silhouetted in moonlight.
You travelin' right now, gal. You  asleep and you don't even know it. (extends his hand) Now... come on inside with me.
Rae looks like a terrified child. Her eyes well with tear as she shakes her head. Laz takes a step toward her.
Mm-mm... Mm-mm...
Come on, gal...
She turns and runs away as best she can. Laz chases after her. He's much older than her and a bit slower, but her  balance betrays her. Laz wraps his arms around her. Rae screams to the sky.
NO! NOOO! NOOOOOOOOOO!

And then, stillness. Rae lies limp in Laz's arms, unconsc He reaches down and lifts her wrist to his face. The gree screen of the digital watch pulsates with the alarm. He pushes the side button. The beeping stops. Silence.
Laz lays Rae back onto his couch. Her eyes open into slit She can see Laz's form over her like the man in her night Rae grabs Laz's wrist. He flinches with her force.
(the whisper of a  child) Is'okay... Is'okay...

Struggling with exhaustion, Rae moves Laz's hand to her b stomach. She rubs it slowly up and down her form,  suggestively. Laz slips his hand away and claps it tight over her eyes. Rae holds her breath, waiting to be molested, her lip  quivering.

(singing deep and  soft) Goin' over that hill. Goin' over  that hill. Well, I ain't gonna stop  until I reach my God's top. I'm goin'  over the hill. Well I went to the  valley, I didn't go to stay. Soul  got happy, I stayed all day. I'm  goin' over that hill.
Rae relaxes and falls into a deep sleep. Laz backs away from her, a touch of fear in his heart. Th voice of Tehronne is heard from earlier in the day.
She a freak. Got what you call a  sexual addiction.
What'chu sayin'?
What I'm tellin' you. Girl gotta get  dick or she go crazy.
Lazarus looks at Tehronne with a furrowed brow, confused.
First hooked up with that bitch when  she was 16. Girl was fuckin' the  principal and two of her teachers.  You know coach Reynolds?
Uh-huh.
He tapped that.
Naw!
Go ask him.
Lazarus opens his barn, slicing through the darkness with his flashlight.
She been bumpin' around all her life,  hookin' up with whoever keep her fed  and fucked.
He crosses to the other side, pulls on a beaded chain tur on the single bulb above his work table.
I seen her give it up on park benches,  back of trucks, hoopty hoods, you  name it.
Laz opens an old wooden box on his work table. He looks  inside.
Laz looks ill. Tehronne checks his pager briefly.
You ever seen a train run on a woman?
Nuh-uh.

Meanin' like a team of fellas go to  work on her and she don't even break  a sweat. (puts his pager away) She into football, you know. You got  a letter on your jacket you get that  pussy in ya lap. I ain't playin'.
Tehronne's friend breaks on the pool table with a sharp c Lazarus is genuinely disturbed.
How a girl get like that?
Like I told you.
Lazarus reaches inside the box and pulls out the end of a old chain.
Girl got a sickness.
The chain rattles as Laz walks backwards, pulling the lon chain from the box. The shouting of his brother can be he
What'chu gonna do? Huh? Nothin'. YOU  AIN'T GONNA DO NOTHIN'! NOTHIN'!
The end of the chain snags, yanking the box over.
Lazarus is bent over, harvesting his tomatoes.
(singing to himself) Tell me who's that writin'? John the  Revelator. Wrote the book of the  seven seals.

Laz enters his home. He crosses to the kitchen and pours  himself a glass of water. Dripping with sweat, he steps back into the room, downing the last of his water. He lowers the glass, noticing Rae  looking at him.
Hey.
Rae lifts her head off the pillow. Laz comes to her side helps her sit up.
Take it easy now. Don't rush it.
(a scratchy whisper) How long... how long I been out?
You been in and out goin' on two...  maybe two days.
(can't believe it) Two days?
After your fever broke, you'd wake  up in spells... long enough to get  that medicine in ya.
Rae sits up on the couch, the quilt wrapped around her wa She looks at the cough syrup bottle on the side table.
Found you on the side of the road.  Someone took to beatin' on you pretty  bad. You know who done that to you?
Rae touches the cut over her eye. That evening is still a blur.
Where's Ronnie?
Well I don't...
(remembering) Wait. He left.
Rae lifts her head, revealing tears in her eyes. She gets mad at herself and wipes them away.
I don't got any money... for fixin'  me up and all.
Don't need none.
Then I better be on my way. Don't  wanna put you out no more.
Think it'd be best if you stayed put  while we talk.
Naw'sir... I gotta be on my way.
Best try gettin' ya wits about you  'fore you try to...

Rae struggles for balance as she attempts to stand. The q falls away as a heavy chain slides off the couch and thud on the floor by her feet. Rae feels a tug. She looks down to see a dark chain locked around her thin waist and coiled on the floor. The opposite end is locked around the side coil of the radiator. She is chained to the house, a prisoner.
Let me say somethin' first...
Why you got me chained?
Way I see it, it's gonna take a while  for you to get right.
The fuck you been doin' to me?
I ain't laid a hand on ya but to  ease yo fever... Remember like I  say, I found you in the road...
(yanks at the chain  around her waist) Get this Goddamn thing off me!
Rae stumbles as she moves away from Laz. Laz tries to rea her.

Now, no harm's come to you... and I  aim to keep it that way. Ain't  gonna... gonna run a train over ya...  or however you call it... see... you  was runnin' wild on me... these fever  dreams you was havin'... these fits.  I'd be chasin' you all night.
Well I'm woke now... you can take  this off.
Rae waits.
Gal, you ain't right yet.
I'm right enough to stand on my own  two feet. Now take this Goddamn chain  off...
How you let men treat ya like they  do?
What?
These men you up under. How you let  them do ya like that?
(grips the chain) Do me? Do me like this, you mean?  Like chainin' me up?
You know what I'm talkin' about. (beat) All that mess with ya teachers and...  boys in the backs of trucks.
(shocked) The hell you know about me?! You got  no right to talk to me about that  shit! The hell you think you are?
(interrupting) I've saved ya life, gal. I can do  and say whatever the fuck I want.
Rae begins to feel a pang of panic. She goes to the chain locked around the radiator. She yanks on it a few times.
I give ya enough chain so's you can  get about the house. Get you to the  kitchen. You need the bathroom, it'll  reach.
What do you want?
We got everything we need. Plenty of  food. Ya medicine still got a few  good swallows in it...
WHAT DO YOU WANT FROM ME?! (Laz can't answer) WHATEVER YOU GONNA DO TO ME, JUST DO  IT! AND LET ME GO!
God saw to it to put you in my path.  And I aim to cure ya of your  wickedness.
This statement terrifies Rae. The fear can be seen in her eyes. She backs away -- the chain scrapes across the floo
You some kind'a pervert?
No ma'am.
Some crazy Jesus freak, gonna fuck  the spirit into me...
In my house, you watch that lip...
(furious, near tears) Look it, mister... you wanna have  your way, you take it. I'll do  whatever you want. But you gotta let  me go. You can't do this! You can't  KEEP ME HERE!
You sick. You got a sickness... we  broke that fever... we gonna break  that hold the devil got on ya.
Rae pushes Laz back and bolts for the door. Laz falls bac against the side table by the couch, toppling the lamp.
The door slams against the house as Rae rushes out in her wolf shirt and panties -- the chain trailing behind her.
(screaming) HELP!
Laz watches as the coil unravels and snaps taut, yanking the old radiator. Clank! The chain whips Rae down to the ground. Laz watche as dust flies of the radiator with each tug.
SOMEBODY!
The fear in Laz's face is replaced with a grin as he watc his radiator hold firm.
SOMEBODY HELP ME!

Outside, Rae bucks and screams, yanking on the chain like wild mustang. Her bare feet and legs are soiled with fres mud and grass as she claws at the ground. Laz crosses to the radiator and pats it like a proud pare his wedding ring clicks against the iron.
(to the radiator) Ain't gonna be moved.
He steps outside with resolve and strength. He picks up t chain and wraps it around his fist.
GAL! I ain't gonna be moved on this!
Laz yanks her back, dragging her towards him. He grips th taut chain with his other hand and yanks her closer.
LET ME GO!

You can holla y'self hoarse. Ain't  gonna bend my will. (pulls her closer) Right or wrong, you gonna mind me. (Pulls her again) Gonna suffer you like Jesus say, to  the FAITHLESS and the PERVERSE  GENERATION.
Rae is spent. She turns to look at her captor as he wrang her back to the porch.
Now you get up! And you get in my  house!
Or what?
Rae spits at Laz. Bad idea.

Rae is screaming and grunting as Laz, standing in his kit tugs on the chain around the door-jam like he's drawing w from a well. Outside Rae struggles to hold onto the porch post. Laz pu hard, lifting her lower torso off the ground.
Stop it! Stop it! IT HURTS!
Whose doin' is that?
Laz yanks. Rae loses her grip and slams onto the porch.
Okay... OKAY! I'M COMIN' IN! NOW  QUIT IT!
The pulling stops. Rae picks herself up. Her knees and ha are scraped and bleeding. The two stare at each other.
Say we talk. Just take a seat on the  sofa. I'll get us somethin' cool to  drink.
Laz crosses to the kitchen. Rae sits down on the couch,  noticing the fallen lamp on the floor.
You may not remember. But you spent  a whole half day in my tub, tryin'  to cool down. Melted four ice trays.

He finishes preparing the two waters. He crosses into the front room. Rae is not there. CRASH! Rae smashes the lamp on Laz's head. The water glas shatter as Laz falls to the floor. Rae picks up a wooden chair and breaks it over his back.  Before she can do any more damage, Laz grabs her by the w and throws her to the couch. Rae falls to the floor. Laz stumbles on his feet as he  clutches his bleeding head. He loses his cool.
Wicked little bitch... gonna cut  me...
You gonna get a lot more a'that, you  keep me locked up like this!
Rae freezes as she sees Laz undo his belt buckle. Her bre starts to quiver as she deeply inhales and exhales.
Think I'm gonna let you do me like  that...
Laz whips his belt off and wraps the buckle around his fi He stops in his tracks. Rae is panting and shaking. Her m finger is scratching at her own thigh.
(regaining his cool) Okay, now... I ain't gonna hit'cha. (the burning is  starting) Just lost my cool there. (he throws the belt  away) Now take that look out'cha eye.
Her anguished hum can be heard through her clenched teeth she rocks back and forth. Her hands wander down to her in thighs.
No, ma'am. You stop that foolishness.
(shaking her head) Hm-mm... Hm-mm...
I said... STOP!
(on the verge of crying) I CAN'T!

Rae gets dizzy. She rests the top of her head on the floo and sways back and forth. Laz rushes out the front door. As the wave hits, Rae twists and turns, wrapping the chai around her. She grips the radiator with both hands and re her face against the side.
Hmmmmmm... Stop-it!... STOP-IT!

The wave is about to build in to a powerful climax. Rae g for breath. The door slams open. Laz drenches her with a gallon of co well water from a tin bucket. Rae inhales and freezes. La waits and watches. The burning is gone. Laz kneels next to her and gently frees her bare ankle fr the tangled chain.
You hungry?
They are both seated on the front porch with paper plates their laps. Laz watches with amusement as Rae tears into chicken and gobbles up the vegetables.
I put some back ache into growin'  them greens. You should slow down  and see how they taste.
Rae remains under Lazarus' intense gaze as the cicadas si

Rae stares off at orange clouds and purple sky. She takes step to her left, walking through the parallel rows of sq The chain gently rattles behind her. Laz has given her ab 20 feet of slack. He holds the chain tight around his fis Rae grins, standing proud in her wolf shirt and panties.
You like this? Walkin' me through  this field like I's your mule?
Can't sit all day on that sofa. Need  to get your legs strong.
(sassy) If I break one you gonna shoot me?
Rae teases Laz by adjusting her panties. She turns back t the sunset and stretches.
Rae's smoldering eyes don't leave Laz as he chains her to the radiator. Laz nervously preaches, trying to avoid the sight of her bare legs curled up on his couch.

My Daddy was one of the first mens  to organize soil conservation in  these parts. That's a group of  farmers, you know, each season they'd  rotate the crop. Know why it's best  to rotate em like that?
Uh-uh.
Laz moves in close and starts applying antibacterial crea to the cut above Rae's eye.

Cuz once in a while soil need a  change. Corn take up a lot of nitrate  in the fertilizer. So next crop what  ya do is plant ya some soy beans.  That give off a lot of nitrate. Change  keeps it all growin' and growin'  strong. (regarding the eye) Sting a bit?
Itches.
Means ya healin'. (a nod) So all this farmin' make me think on  Matthew. Matthew 13. The parable of  the sower? Man toss seed on rock, on  the wayside, some fell in thorns...  you know the story?
Uh-uh.
Laz starts putting the cream on her scabbed knees. He rub them gently.
The seed that land on good soil is  for them who hear the word of God...  and understand the word of God. Not  enough for you to hear what I'm  sayin', you gotta understand.
I know. I get it. What's Matthew  doin'?

Gal... Matthew ain't doin' shit...  this just a story... (quelling his  frustration) Look it. I've seen it in nature,  I've seen it in men. Ya got to change  up your crop. Cuz that seed ain't  gettin' in. (Rae remains silent) Ya gotta cut this shit out. Got no  cause to be up under these fools,  ruttin' on ya like you a bitch. Like  you somebody's dog. No woman... who  joins in union with Almighty God...  or man... in the sanctity of  marriage... should degrade herself...  and bend to ANOTHER MAN'S WILL!
Rae is aware that Laz is somewhere else, talking to someo else other than her. There is anger in his tone as he rub ointment on her bare, scabbed knees.

(shouting) My God, gal, don't you got no SENSE?  I ain't sayin' I ain't weak? Shit.  Playin' guitar in the blood-bucket  jukes all ya life... a nigga learn  how to sin, let me tell you! (grips her by the  legs) I GOT SIN IN ME! I AIN'T GO'N LIE!  BUT I GOT RESPECT! AND ALL YOU GOT  IS BILE, GAL!
Let go of me...
GIVIN' UP THAT SWITCH LIKE A TRAMP!  BEHIND MY BACK AND KILL MY BABY...!
Rae yanks free of Laz's grip, recoiling on the couch.
GET OFF ME!
Laz awakens from his rant. He blinks and stands. A sudden shame overtakes him. He crosses into the kitchen to hide the sink. He pours Rae a glass of water and returns to her side.
(offering her the  glass) Didn't mean to go off on a tear like  I did. I just got to thinkin' about  things...

Why is it you old men gotta talk so  much? Like little boys, gotta talk  yourself into fuckin' me. (his knuckles touch  her skin) We can take our time. I'm grown. I  get it. (she leans even closer) You wanna give me 'nother bath?

Laz looks at himself in the reflection of Rose's vanity  mirror, listening to Rae stir in the next room.
The cicadas are screaming outside. Rae is beginning to br deep, the burning is coming on.

She folds her arms over her chest, her middle finger  scratching her elbow. The anxiety is too much. She rolls  over until the chain pulls taut against the radiator. Rae has wrapped herself in a tangle of chain. Her breathi relaxes. Her eyes close. She sleeps.

Y'all know when Ella Mae's open up?
You needin' to buy some pantyhose?
Just some dresses.

Rae snaps awake. She is wet with sweat from the morning h
Hello? Hey!

I don't believe this shit.

She folds her arms and looks into the kitchen. There on t table is a covered plate and a small bottle of milk. Rae  reads a note on top of the plate: BE BACK FOR SUPPER. She pulls off the top plate and finds sausage links, eggs biscuits, sliced tomatoes, and sliced peaches.
Enough to choke a Goddamn horse.

I'm needin' some women's clothes. A  few dresses. Maybe some shoes. But  they gotta be nice. They gotta be  proper. Clothes a woman would want,  where she could feel and look like a  woman without... you know, lookin'  like a tramp or a hussy or somethin'.

And, sir... do you have a size in  mind for what you're lookin' for?

Mind I ask, what's all this business  here?

It's called  Ginger Souffle. I recommend...  applying the cream while the skin is  still damp. So... perhaps just after  a shower.

Oooooo.

(trying to sing) You are my sunshine. My only sunshine.  You make me happy when skies are  gray. You'll never know dear how  much I love you. Please don't take  my sunshine away. A voice from outside  spins her around. The guitar barks  as Rae slams it down on the table.

SHIT BOY! WHAT THE HELL YOU...!
Lincoln is tossed off the porch, clinging to his overalls
CAN'T LEAVE YOU ALONE FOR ONE...
Tears and fear come to Lincoln as Laz steps out onto the  porch, fuming with rage. Lincoln backs away expecting a good beating. He starts ru up the drive but stops as R.L.'s Olds rolls up the drive.
Lincoln, come on back.
Lincoln darts past Laz and runs into the barn, clutching overalls. R.L. stops the car halfway down the drive and s out.
Was that Lincoln James I seen run  off?
He's fine. Just had a bad fall.
Why's his britches round his knees?
R.L., you gonna have to get on. I  can't have nobody round my place.
R.L. starts walking up the drive.
You get a call from Rose?
This ain't got nothin' to do with  that woman. Just don't want nobody  around me now.
Somethin' wrong with ya phone? Been  callin' the last few days.
R.L. stops in his tracks as Lazarus pulls out his hunting rifle from the rack behind his seat in his truck.
Goin' dove huntin'?
You gotta go, R.L.. I ain't foolin'  this time.
You sayin' that gun's for me if I  don't?
Spell it out, Laz. Man big enough to  pull a gun best have a tongue in his  mouth if he ain't got a brain in his  head.
Laz is struggling. The rifle feels suddenly strange to hi
You ain't gonna talk me outta shit  no more. I got my mind made up and I  ain't gonna be moved on this.
(amused) Ain't gonna be moved?
Got no place for preachin' here. Not  now. So you do as I say...
(still stepping closer) Or what?
I told you to TURN BACK!
R.L. pushes his chest up against the rifle and shouts bac
YOU GO'ON AND SHOOT ME, KILLA!
Laz's heart is breaking. He is pointing a gun at his only friend. R.L. snatches the rifle out of Laz's hands.

Ought'a stomp yo ass pointing this  at me. (unloads the rifle) Always gotta bring up the preachin'.  Like you just a sheep in my flock  and all I'm good for is poundin' on  a pulpit. (gets in Laz's face) Dammit, Laz... we may not be blood.  But we sucked off the same old nurse  since the day we was slapped on the  ass. And you gonna point a gun at  me?
A tear rolls down Laz's cheek. The shame is unbearable.
If you in some trouble, than WE gonna  figure somethin' out. You and me. (hands him a bandana) Wipe your face!
Laz takes the bandana and wipes the tears away.
Now... this got anything to do with  Rose? (Laz shakes his head) Then what?
The door creaks open. R.L. carefully steps inside. Rae is sitting on the couch, looking out the window.
(on the verge of tears) I didn't want to.
Rae doesn't respond. R.L. quickly steps outside shutting door behind him.
R.L. shakes his head as Laz follows him off the porch.
Are you outta ya GODDAMN MIND?
Man like you ought not take the Lord's  name like you just done.
A naked woman, chained in ya house?
I'm tellin' you the truth, dammit. I  found her beat. Left for dead. So I  brung her home.
Laz, I know about that girl. (beat) Good number of this town's sinners  got my ear, you know. (shakes his head) Oh, Laz. She's had a mess of crabs  and them STD's. What'chu thinking?
I haven't laid a hand. On my life,  R.L., my wick is dry on this.
You say she was beat on. You call  the sheriff on that?
Put yo'self in my shoes. Say you out  here, alone, with a beaten, half  naked, white woman loves to fuck. I  been toe to toe with the law in this  town for no more than being black  and nearby.
What's that chain around her for?
Laz briefly looks off at the barn, knowing Lincoln is the
Why don't you go'on and ask her. She  need to talk wit somebody with sense.  Folks been ruttin' and beatin' on  this gal all her days. And this is  how I'm handling it.
THIS IS HOW YOU HANDLING IT? THIS IS  HOW YOU HANDLING IT?
Silence.
Go in and talk to her. Please.
R.L. nods. Lazarus smiles.
Good. Makin' steaks for supper. I  expect you to come.
You mean with you and that woman  chained to ya radiator?
You treat folks special when they  company. It's just supper, R.L.,  shit.
One thing at a time, Laz.
Laz walks toward the barn and turns back to R.L..
Watch y'self in there. That girl'll  jump on ya junk like a grasshopper.
Laz opens the door to his barn wide, allowing the afterno light to find Lincoln sitting on an old tire, weeping.
Did I hurt'chu?
Lincoln shakes his head. Laz carefully sits next to him.
What happened in there... that won't  your fault. Ain't a young man alive  could keep they britches on with  that girl being in heat like she is.
Why she got a chain on her?
That's between her and me. It's  private. And I don't want you goin'  off and tellin' ya daddy.
(in a panic) Please don't tell my daddy.
My mouth is shut, boy. And that's  how we gonna keep it. Don't go  braggin' to ya buddies, ya heard me?
Lincoln nods. Laz hands him the bandana R.L. gave him.
So... (a bonding smile) That your first time?
Yes'sir.
You struck some gold, didn't ya?
Lincoln grins as he wipes the snot from his nose.
Shit. My first time was with my second  cousin behind my uncle's barn. She  weighed two tons, if a pound. Could'a  done a lot better for myself. You  sho'nuf did.
R.L. hands Rae a glass of water. She is seated on the sof wrapped in a quilt.
Thank you.
(sits next to her) I gotta ask you. Why do you think  Laz is keepin' you chained like this?
(shrugs at first,  then:) You know how, like they say, you  save someone's life, you responsible  for them. Guess he just don't think  it's safe for me.

So he got it into his head that the  only thing gonna keep you from endin'  up bleedin' on the side of the road  again, without a stitch of clothing  on is... (R.L. yanks on the  chain) You think he's crazy for thinkin'  that?
Rae struggles to answer. Something is on her mind.
You a preacher?
That's right.

Can I ask you a question? (R.L. nods) People always say, you gotta get  good with Jesus, if you want not to  go to hell. That you say sorry for  all you done and... and Jesus would  let you go on to heaven.
You could put it that way.
But that's so fuckin' stupid. (she catches herself) I'm sorry. Didn't mean to curse.
What's on your mind?
You can't hurt people... and then  just say, I'm sorry, and then  everything just gets washed away.  Why would heaven want people like  that. People who... do what they  want and then... switch.

I'm gonna tell you somethin', and  it's just gonna be between you and  me. (Rae anxiously nods) I think folks carry on about heaven  too much. Like it's some all-you-can- eat buffet up in the clouds. And  folks just gonna do as they're told  so they can eat what they want behind  some pearly gates. I can go to  Shoney's for that.
Rae grins. R.L. leans closer.

There's sin in my heart. There's  evil in this world. But when I got  no one... I talk to God. I ask for  strength. I ask for forgiveness. Not  for peace at the end of my days when  there's no more life to live and no  more good to do, but today. Right  now.
Rae has never had anyone talk to her like this. She is  listening. She is understanding.
What's your heaven? What gives you  peace?
Rae looks at her bare feet. She tries to respond but the  pain in her chokes back the words. Tears come to her.
(struggling to speak) Ronnie.
A bus stops at the station. The doors swing open. A few  passengers exit the bus followed by Ronnie. He is not wearing his uniform.
He drops his duffle bag and pops a few quarters in the ph He waits, allows the phone to ring.

(into the phone) This is Ronnie again. Don't know if  you been gettin' my messages but...  I'm down at the bus station and... (struggles) I just need you come get me. You get  this message, I'm on the interstate  headin' downtown toward the square. (sadness hits) Rae. I really need you to... come  find me. Please.

(a look of  disappointment) Gal, I been around hard-cursin' folk  all my life. And let me tell you...

If all you got is filth comin' out'cha  mouth... people just gonna tune ya  out. (interrupting her) Rae. RAE! I'm not fightin' with ya.  I just know you got more in you than  junk. (a breath) Now, you sayin' you don't know how  to cook anything at all? (Rae shrugs) You know how to boil water?
I can handle that.

The four of them (Rae, Laz, Lincoln, and R.L.) are all se at the kitchen table, holding hands as R.L. says grace. Rae peeks at the others with their eyes closed tight. She follows their example. R.L.  We ask that you bless this meal put before us. May food nourish our bodies and this fellowship nourish our  spirit. In Jesus name we pray. Amen.
Amen.

Pass them potatoes, Lincoln.
Y'all let me know if these steaks  are too dry.
This all looks wonderful.
I skipped lunch.
Well, dig in, son. Got plenty to  eat.
Rae's eyes are fixed on R.L. as he picks up a devilled eg She looks over at Laz who is aware of her anxiety. He giv her a wink. R.L. bites into the egg and moans with delight.
(to Laz) Mm. MM. Now these eggs got some kick  to it. What'chu got in this?
(motions to Rae) Ask the chef.
Everyone looks at Rae, surprised. She feels a sudden rush fear as she struggles to answer R.L.'s question.
Cayenne pepper.
Ronnie is walking by the bar along the interstate. He sto when he sees Gill's truck.
Ronnie adjusts his duffle bag over his shoulder as he ent the mid-sized bar. Gill is seated at the bar. He turns to Ronnie along with few other locals, one being HERMAN, age 40.
(surprised) Holy shit.
(understanding) Yeah.
Sit down, man. Need a beer?
Sure.
(to the bartender) Marv, let's get Ronnie set up here.
Ronnie sits next to Gill. Herman leans in wanting to be a part of the conversation.
Hey, Herman.
They buy you that big chicken dinner?
Ronnie stiffens. Gill is confused.
What?

They got little names for everything  in the corps when they trying to get  rid of ya. Don't know what it's like  in the guard. There's what you call  a bad conduct discharge, a BCD... we  all called it the big chicken dinner.  It ain't the brig but it'll fuck ya  for life if you wantin' to work for  the government.

Ad-sep. Administrative separation.

Blowin' boys in the head, for one.

Whoa, son! I ain't sayin' shit about  you. I'm just talkin'.

Hey, it's alright, man. It's alright. (to Herman) Herman. Come on. He just got back.
Herman gets up to leave with his beer.
To get back ya had to've gone  somewhere.
Ronnie glares at Herman as he moves to the other side of bar. Gill moves closer to Ronnie to get the whole story.
What happened?

They been keepin' a folder on me cuz  of my stomach. Like how it was just  before we'd play ball back in school.  Thought it was just some tic I got,  or ulcers like my daddy had. (takes a drink) I can't... shoot. Target practice  I'm a pro. I tag between the numbers  each time but... (feels a stomach cramp) But when there's really loud noises  around me... somethin' happens. I  get shaky and... I lose my breath.  They called it anxiety. Severe  anxiety. It can be fixed and all...  just not in time for.... (another drink) It's a long process but... they sent  me home.
I guess it could be worse. You could  be comin' back in a body bag.
Gill doesn't know what to say next.
I can't get Rae on the phone. She's  not at home... none of her friends  seen her anywhere.
She's around. Always is.
I don't know. She's gettin' crazy,  like she gets. Begged me not to go.  Got real down. I just think somethin's  happened. Like she run off with  someone. You'd tell me if you knew  somethin', right?

Gill's truck rounds the bend and up the gravel drive lead up to Ronnie's trailer. The headlights scan across the porch as Gill parks.
Ronnie is the first through the door, calling out for Rae before he can turn on the lights.
Rae?
Gill enters. He sees that the trailer is the same as it w the day he picked up Ronnie, nothing is different.
This don't feel right. Kitchen looks  just like I left it. I know, cuz I  cleaned it.

Gill is disturbed by Ronnie's sudden flood of emotion and tears. He crosses to the pantry, already knowing which  cupboard to pull the liquor out of. He pours two drinks. He hands one to Ronnie.
Drink. Come on, drink some.

Her momma works down at the grocery,  down on the square. Maybe she seen  her.

Ronnie. You can't see cuz you're too  close to it. (Ronnie waits) These nervous spells you get. You  never had that shit back in school...

YOU HAD A PLAN! YOU HAD A GODDAMN  LIFE! AND SHE JUST FUCKED THE GUTS  OUT OF YOU!

The only thing that cunt's had behind  her is me and half the town fuckin'  her. (Ronnie can't believe  it) Your first night away, I come over  and drop off the spare keys like you  wanted me to. You weren't gone two  hours and she was aching to get me  inside her. Like she was havin' some  kind'a fit.

The front door burst open as Gill goes flying down the fr porch. Ronnie cocks a .45 and shoves it into his belt. Ronnie pins Gill's elbow behind his back and retrieves th keys from his front pocket.

Laz and R.L. are smoking. Laz smiles as he watches Lincol and Rae through the kitchen window as they wash dishes an talk about football.

Thought that's why you been keepin'  to yourself out here. (Laz conceals his  pain) I don't know how much of this is to  make her happy or to hurt you. But  it is what it is.
